page.title: 07THE ARK ROYAL
page.content: On Friday 28th June,1985,H.M.S "Ark Royal"a 30,000 tonne aircraft carrier,sailed from Tyneside to Portsmouth.It is the fifth vessel to be called "Ark Royal" and is probably the last aircraft carrier to be built for the Royal Navy."Ark Royal" was built at British Shipbuilders' Wallsend yard of Swan Hunter's and was completed three months ahead of schedule.When in service with the Royal Navy,"Ark Royal" will protect other ships in wartime and lead a taskforce if needed.It will carry Sea King helicopters which will hunt out and destroy enemy submarines,and Sea Harrier vertical/short take-off and landing jet aeroplanes which will attack enemy positions.
